summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ Office of the Inspector General agents with a retired BOP Regional Director regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The interview focuses on the after-action report, security failures, camera system issues, and staff responsibilities leading up to Epstein's suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate who died by suicide at MCC on August 10, 2019. The interview discusses the circumstances surrounding his death, cellmate assignments, and security failures.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate involved in a July 23, 2019 incident where Epstein was found with a rope around his neck. Tartaglione claimed Epstein tried to hang himself.

persons.name: Raymond
persons.context: The witness being interviewed. He was the Regional Director for the Northeast region overseeing MCC at the time of Epstein's death. He retired in December 2019.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center who reported to the regional director. Discussed cellmate assignments and communications regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Captain at MCC involved in the chain of command for notifying staff about Epstein's cellmate requirement and camera issues.

persons.name: Skipper-Scott
persons.context: MCC Internal Investigator who was involved in notifications about camera failures and the after-action investigation.

persons.name: Carlos Perez
persons.context: Operations lieutenant on duty who knew Epstein's cellmate was leaving but didn't pass information to his relief or ensure Epstein got a new cellmate.

persons.name: Cannata
persons.context: Relieving operations lieutenant who should have been notified about Epstein needing a new cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: SIS lieutenant who became aware on August 8, 2019, that MCC cameras were not recording.

persons.name: Comtech
persons.context: Communications technician notified about camera system failures at MCC.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Unit manager who provided Epstein with an unmonitored social phone call on August 9, 2019, to call his mother.

connections.description: Raymond was the Regional Director overseeing Warden at MCC. They communicated about Epstein's case and institutional issues.
Were cellmates in July 2019. Involved in incident where Epstein was found with rope around neck.
Raymond oversaw the captain as part of the MCC chain of command.
Both were operations lieutenants at MCC. Perez failed to pass critical information about Epstein's cellmate to Cannata.
Warden supervised the captain at MCC regarding Epstein's housing and security measures.

events.title: Epstein-Tartaglione incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein found with rope around his neck in cell with inmate Tartaglione. Tartaglione claimed Epstein tried to hang himself.

events.title: Cellmate transferred, unmonitored phone call
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was transferred from MCC. Epstein was provided an unmonitored social phone call by unit manager to call his deceased mother.

events.title: Epstein found dead
events.description: At 6:33 a.m., body alarm activated in SHU. Epstein found unresponsive in his cell. CPR initiated. Pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by emergency room physician.

events.title: Camera system failure discovered
events.description: MCC SIS Lieutenant and II discovered cameras were not recording. Notified Comtech and Captain. System had stopped recording since July 29.

events.title: OIG interview with retired Regional Director
events.description: DOJ OIG agents interview retired BOP Regional Director Raymond about Epstein's death, after-action report, and security failures at MCC.

locations: GEO prison (where Epstein's cellmate was transferred)
keyFacts: The retired Regional Director stated that not providing Epstein with a cellmate and failure to conduct proper rounds/counts were the two main factors that led to his suicide.
MCC had replacement camera equipment since October 2018 but hadn't installed it before Epstein's death in August 2019, despite known system failures.
Epstein was given an unmonitored phone call on August 9, 2019, where he claimed to call his deceased mother; a male answered the phone.
The after-action report indicated multiple staff knew Epstein required a cellmate, but no fail-safe system ensured this requirement was met after his initial cellmate was transferred.
The witness acknowledged the political nature of the investigation, noting there were 'a dozen suicides that year' but only Epstein's was being investigated.
